trans-unit.source: How to use the SendGrid email service (PHP) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use the SendGrid email service (PHP) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written in PHP.
trans-unit.target: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written in PHP.

trans-unit.source: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the SendGrid email service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the SendGrid email service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in PHP.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in PHP.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include constructing email, sending email, and adding attachments.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include constructing email, sending email, and adding attachments.

trans-unit.source: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the <linkText>Next Steps</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the <linkText>Next Steps</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs that make custom integration easy.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs that make custom integration easy.

trans-unit.source: Common SendGrid usage scenarios include:
trans-unit.target: Common SendGrid usage scenarios include:

trans-unit.source: Automatically sending receipts to customers
trans-unit.target: Automatically sending receipts to customers

trans-unit.source: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly e-fliers and special offers
trans-unit.target: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly e-fliers and special offers

trans-unit.source: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked e-mail, and customer responsiveness
trans-unit.target: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked e-mail, and customer responsiveness

trans-unit.source: Generating reports to help identify trends
trans-unit.target: Generating reports to help identify trends

trans-unit.source: Forwarding customer inquiries
trans-unit.target: Forwarding customer inquiries

trans-unit.source: Email notifications from your application
trans-unit.target: Email notifications from your application

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>https://sendgrid.com</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>https://sendgrid.com</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Using SendGrid in an Azure PHP application requires no special configuration or coding.
trans-unit.target: Using SendGrid in an Azure PHP application requires no special configuration or coding.

trans-unit.source: Because SendGrid is a service, it can be accessed in exactly the same way from a cloud application as it can from an on-premises application.
trans-unit.target: Because SendGrid is a service, it can be accessed in exactly the same way from a cloud application as it can from an on-premises application.

trans-unit.source: You can send email using either SMTP or the Web API provided by SendGrid.
trans-unit.target: You can send email using either SMTP or the Web API provided by SendGrid.

trans-unit.source: To send email using the SendGrid SMTP API, use Swift Mailer, a component-based library for sending emails from PHP applications.
trans-unit.target: To send email using the SendGrid SMTP API, use Swift Mailer, a component-based library for sending emails from PHP applications.

trans-unit.source: You can download the Swift Mailer library from http://swiftmailer.org/download v5.3.0 (use [Composer] to install Swift Mailer).
trans-unit.target: You can download the Swift Mailer library from http://swiftmailer.org/download v5.3.0 (use [Composer] to install Swift Mailer).

trans-unit.source: Sending email with the library involves creating instances of the Swift\SmtpTransport, Swift\Mailer, and Swift\Message classes, setting the appropriate properties, and calling the Swift\Mailer::send method.
trans-unit.target: Sending email with the library involves creating instances of the Swift\SmtpTransport, Swift\Mailer, and Swift\Message classes, setting the appropriate properties, and calling the Swift\Mailer::send method.

trans-unit.source: Use PHP's <linkText>curl function</linkText><title></title> to send email using the SendGrid Web API.
trans-unit.target: Use PHP's <linkText>curl function</linkText><title></title> to send email using the SendGrid Web API.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid's Web API is very similar to a REST API, though it is not truly a RESTful API since, in most calls, both GET and POST verbs can be used interchangeably.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid's Web API is very similar to a REST API, though it is not truly a RESTful API since, in most calls, both GET and POST verbs can be used interchangeably.

trans-unit.source: Sending an attachment using the SMTP API involves one additional line of code to the example script for sending an email with Swift Mailer.
trans-unit.target: Sending an attachment using the SMTP API involves one additional line of code to the example script for sending an email with Swift Mailer.

trans-unit.source: The additional line of code is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The additional line of code is as follows:

trans-unit.source: This line of code calls the attach method on the Swift\Message object and uses static method fromPath on the Swift\Attachment class to get and attach a file to a message.
trans-unit.target: This line of code calls the attach method on the Swift\Message object and uses static method fromPath on the Swift\Attachment class to get and attach a file to a message.

trans-unit.source: Sending an attachment using the Web API is very similar to sending an email using the Web API.
trans-unit.target: Sending an attachment using the Web API is very similar to sending an email using the Web API.

trans-unit.source: However, note that in the example that follows, the parameter array must contain this element:
trans-unit.target: However, note that in the example that follows, the parameter array must contain this element:

trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of 'filters'.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of 'filters'.

trans-unit.source: These are settings that can be added to an email message to enable specific functionality such as enabling click tracking, Google analytics, subscription tracking, and so on.
trans-unit.target: These are settings that can be added to an email message to enable specific functionality such as enabling click tracking, Google analytics, subscription tracking, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Filters can be applied to a message by using the filters property.
trans-unit.target: Filters can be applied to a message by using the filters property.

trans-unit.source: Each filter is specified by a hash containing filter-specific settings.
trans-unit.target: Each filter is specified by a hash containing filter-specific settings.

trans-unit.source: The following example enables the footer filter and specifies a text message that will be appended to the bottom of the email message.
trans-unit.target: The following example enables the footer filter and specifies a text message that will be appended to the bottom of the email message.

trans-unit.source: For this example we will use [sendgrid-php library].
trans-unit.target: For this example we will use [sendgrid-php library].

trans-unit.target: Use [Composer] to install library:
